ALLAN: Prescription drugs are so common that they have come to feel safe.
ALLAN: Even if the lable on the bottle warns us not to drive or operate machinery while taking the medication we may not take it seriously.
ALLAN: Even though we might have driven while taking medication without problems in the past that doesn't mean the risk isn't higher.
ALLAN: For example research tells us that people taking anti-anxiety medication like valium or xanax have double the odds of causing a crash compaired to alcohol and drug-free drivers.
ALLAN: Research also shows that mixing alcohol with certain prescription drugs such as valium, darvan, or codine increases risk for imapairment problems such as DUI arrests, crashes, injuries, and death.
